main.name: Tina Fang
main.description: Interested in front-end development, business analysis, and art
main.bio: Hi there! I am Tina! During my study at my previous university, I joined the Google DSC and it sparked my interests in front-end development. Since then I have been self-learning Figma, CSS, HTML, Javascript, and React, and I will take related university courses in the following terms as an Information Systems student. I have also learnt object-oriented programming in C++, Java, and database management. Besides my academics, while working at ShopBack, I often needed to communicate suggestions for improvement in UX and more efficient testing workflow among my supervisors, managers, and colleagues. These experiences have helped me develop both my UI/UX and object-oriented programming skills.

education.description: Taken accounting fundamentals, leadership & management, Java, IS fundamentals, and database design

Taken engineering calculus, probability & statistics, linear algebra, physics, and information technology, as well as circuit analysis, basic electronics, logic design, industrial training, and basic computer programming in C++ and Python

work.title: Quality Assurance Intern
work.description: Tested functionalities for the ShopBack application including search, membership authentication, and user interaction functions, and gave suggestions on UX design. Reported bugs and their causes through Jira. Redesigned the end-to-end testing script for release candidates of the ShopBack application.

testimonials.text: Sonny is absolutely excellent, his depth of knowledge & his mentorship really meant a lot to us... I would definitely recommend
Learning with Sonny has been AWESOME, he makes learning React so easy and approachable, you'll finally feel like you know what's going on!
